sections.text: This Act may be called the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908. It extends to the whole of India except the State of Jammu and Kashmir.
Courts to try all civil suits unless barred: The Courts shall have jurisdiction to try all suits of a civil nature excepting suits of which their cognizance is either expressly or impliedly barred.
Institution of suits: Every suit shall be instituted by the presentation of a plaint or in such other manner as may be prescribed.

Notice to government or public officer before instituting suit: No suit shall be instituted against the Government or against a public officer in respect of any act purporting to be done by such public officer in his official capacity, until the expiration of two months after notice in writing has been delivered to, or left at the office.

Settlement of disputes outside the Court: Where it appears to the Court that there exist elements of a settlement which may be acceptable to the parties, the Court shall formulate the terms of settlement and give them to the parties for their observations.
